page.title: 01THE SOUTHBOURNE AREA
page.content: Southbourne is the largest village in West Sussex,with about 6,000 population.The A27 road runs through Southbourne taking most of the traffic (and the accidents) away from the country lanes,although this is due be replaced by a new motorway passing to the north of Southbourne. Southbourne is a dormitory village because not many people work there. There are many different houses, including large detatched houses,farm houses and council houses.{ Southbourne grew out of Prinsted in the begining of the19th century.The main occupation is arable farming. Hambrook is a small village and is very hilly.There is realy only one shop,the Post Office. Woodmancote is to the east of Hambrook and is the same size.There is one pub called The Woodmancote Arms.
